snippet: Congressional leaders have made clear that the debt ceiling will be part of talks over the so-called fiscal cliff, with many members unwilling to raise the ceiling without a broader deal.
abstract: Treasury Department expects country to hit its debt ceiling of about $16.4 trillion close to the end of 2012, giving Congress only a matter of weeks to raise it before sending financial markets into panic; similar problem led to significant increase in borrowing costs in 2011, and there is reason to expect that House Republicans will again use it as leverage in debt negotiations with the Senate and the White House.
lead_paragraph: Congressional leaders have made clear that the debt ceiling will be part of talks over the so-called fiscal cliff, with many members unwilling to raise the ceiling without a broader deal.
